channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: HK legislator’s firm to lure 1,000 Web3 start-ups over 3 years
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: G-Rocket is aiming to attract 1,000 Web3 start-ups to Hong Kong and will help them with banking, government services and office spaces.

item.title: Crypto Twitter confused by SBF's $250M bail and a return to luxury
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: The crypto community raised many questions about how FTX's former CEO was able to secure bail and the conditions it will come with.

item.title: Binance addresses 7 instances of recent FUD via Chinese blog post
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Binance is fighting back against the tsunami of FUD it has faced in recent weeks.

item.title: BTC miner Core Scientific gets interim nod for $37.4M bankruptcy loan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The loan would allow Core Scientific to keep its mining and hosting operations afloat while it restructures.

item.title: The most eco-friendly blockchain networks in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elizabeth Gail
item.description: This year saw the realignment of the crypto industry toward greener, more energy-efficient blockchains.

item.title: Rating agencies, not regulators, can rebuild trust in crypto after FTX
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ben Goertzel
item.description: Private rating agencies could work better and more quickly than regulators when it comes to reviewing businesses in the cryptocurrency industry.

item.title: BNB Chain now has more unique addresses than Ethereum, developer says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Despite this growth, BNB Chain still has far less unique addresses than Bitcoin.

item.title: Marshall Islands legally recognizes DAOs as domestic limited liability companies
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The law enables legal entities registered in the country to formally adopt DAO structures and governance tools.

item.title: Crypto exchange Bullish announces termination of SPAC deal, citing SEC practices
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Bullish said it had reached a mutual agreement with Far Peak Acquisition to no longer merge in a deal for a listing on the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: FTX creditor committee hires Paul Hastings LLP for bankruptcy proceedings: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: After evaluating several law firms, FTX's unsecured creditors' committee has chosen a legal adviser.

item.title: SBF sent home after his parents put up their house to cover his astronomical bail bond
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The former billionaire, who has since claimed to be worth no more than $100,000, is out of jail on a $250 million bond.

item.title: The driving forces behind crypto adoption in Latin America in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Inflation has fueled crypto growth in the region, stimulating asset tokenization and remittance infrastructure development.

item.title: Brazilian president signs crypto bill into law
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The law includes many digital currencies under the definition of legal payment methods in Brazil and established a licensing regime for virtual asset service providers.

item.title: SBF received special treatment inside Bahamian jail: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried was held in the sick bay where he reportedly had access to running water, a toilet, a TV and vegan food.

item.title: North Korean hacking activity ceases after regulators implement KYC: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Intelligence officials say that out of $620 million in crypto stolen by North Korean hackers this year, none were related to South Korea.

item.title: Third parties could return FTX funds directly to customers: Law firm
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to Louise Abbott, FTX users could claim in court that assets “remained their property at all times” and could be treated separately from bankruptcy proceedings.

item.title: Bitcoin dips below $16.7K as US GDP meets fresh BTC price 'death cross'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin has never seen this particular “death cross” before, one analyst notes as BTC price weakness continues.

item.title: 5 cryptocurrencies to keep an eye on in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Analysts expect the bear market to loosen its grip in 2023. Here are five cryptocurrencies to keep an eye on.

item.title: The Metaverse is awful today… but we can make it great: Yat Siu, Big Ideas
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Fenton

item.title: The Cointelegraph Top 100 list, 2023: Vote on who you think should make it
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: Readers can vote on who will appear at the top of Cointelegraph’s list of the Top 100 in crypto and blockchain.

item.title: Immunefi says it has facilitated $66M in bug bounties since inception
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The average bug bounty payout over 1,248 confirmed reports was $52,800.

item.title: Argentine football league scores metaverse partnership after World Cup triumph
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Argentina’s football association has partnered with metaverse platform Upland following the national team’s World Cup victory in Qatar.

item.title: 40% of 40K respondents plan to buy crypto in 2023: Blockchain.com survey
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Despite a challenging year for the crypto industry, nearly 40% of respondents indicated a plan to purchase cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin in 2023.

item.title: Crypto trader regrets not catching the top of the bull run
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elisha Owusu Akyaw
item.description: In the second episode of Hashing It Out, Cointelegraph’s Elisha Owusu Akyaw (GhCryptoGuy) breaks down the state of the crypto market with CRYPTOBIRB.

item.title: FTX, Alameda execs plead guilty to fraud charges: Community responds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: From wondering where the funds are to ridiculing Caroline Ellison’s trading skills, crypto community members reacted in various ways to news of the executives pleading guilty.

item.title: Bitcoin low volume sparks BTC price warning as metric hits ‘value zone’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin NVT signal data presents conflicting views of what might happen to the current BTC price range.

item.title: Ripple CEO compares Wells Fargo billions mismanagement with FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: One of the biggest banks in America has once again paid a billion-dollar fine for the illegal treatment of its customers.

item.title: Stablecoin settlements can surpass all major card networks in 2023: Data
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: While on-chain stablecoins settlements are growing rapidly, many people pointed out that comparing stablecoin settlements to Visa transactions is not fair as they represent two different things.

item.title: Alameda’s Caroline Ellison escapes potential 110-year prison term via plea deal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Former Alameda Research CEO could be released on $250,000 bail, but she’s not allowed to leave the United States.

item.title: Frozen bank account triggers switch to Bitcoin salary for a whole year
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: How a frozen bank account led one Bitcoin advocate to experiment with living on the Bitcoin Standard.
